Every great story has a new beginning, and yours starts here.Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.Who We Are…When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the storytellers bringing our characters to life, the creators bringing them to your living rooms and the dreamers creating what’s next…From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.SummaryThe Executive Director, Data Science will be responsible for overseeing the Data Science team’s work developing models/conducting analyses using machine learning, regression modeling and time-series forecasting techniques. The team’s work will range from content forecasting, quantifying cross-channel impact on consumer demand, price elasticity analyses, and content price optimization. As team leader, the Executive Director will be responsible for connecting strategic business questions with the team’s analytical work. Furthermore, the Executive Director will help the team remove roadblocks in their analytical work, find alternative approaches to solving new problems, and mentor the individual team members in their professional development.Job ResponsibilitiesData Analytics: Guide team’s work developing statistical models, conducting statistical analyses and performing database analytics with R, Python, and other statistical software to address internal business questions around cross channel interactions, impact of release strategy and windowing on content performance, price elasticity, merchandising and promotion effectiveness, etc. Must have strong knowledge of machine learning, regression and time series forecasting techniques to validate team’s work and to help team troubleshoot analytical roadblocks.Storytelling and visual display of analytic output: Develop consumer analytics dashboards in Tableau, R-Shiny or SAS Visual Analytics to help communicate insights, track customer growth and engagement across partner platforms. Conduct ad hoc queries to help stakeholders better identify digital strategies that are contributing to growth and quantify impacts to multiple business interests. Combine first party anonymized customer data with 3rd party research reports to better understand customer base.Team Leadership and Mentoring: Liaison with business stakeholders to support their analytical needs and create opportunities for the data science team to solve business problems. Proactively identify analytical questions and opportunities for the team. Validate team’s work is meeting business expectations and thoroughly support strategic needs. Finally, mentor team members in their individual professional development.Job RequirementsBachelor’s or Advanced Degree in Statistics, Math or related field is required.10+ years of experience using data science modeling techniques (ie. regression analyses, machine learning, time-series forecasting) on large & small, user-level & market-level datasets to produce customer and marketing insights that have resulted in tangible business improvements.Strong background in pricing analytics and model development, including experimental design experience.Strong proficiency working in relational databases and big-data systems to aggregate, organize, and prepare data for analysis.Experience working with data visualization and reporting tools to display & communicate quantitative information and analytical output to non-technical stakeholders.History of collaborating with business leaders and subject matter experts across all levels of the organization.Proficient with big-data technology, enablement & analytic tools (including Relational Databases, R, Python, SQL, SAS).Creative problem-solver who works well as part of a team.Strong team focus with outstanding organizational and resource management skills.Assist the Executive Director with managing projects and team-members.Ability to liaise & communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholdersHow We Get Things Done…This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.The Legal Bits…In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles in locations where legally required. $125,300.00 - $232,700.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and paid time off (PTO).Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you need a reasonable accommodation in order to apply for this position, please contact us at recruitadmin@warnermedia.com.
